The AutoPay code set up on a credit card
This attribute represents direct debit Account number  which has been setup as part of the regular credit card auto payment.
This attribute represents direct debit BSB of the account number  which has been setup as part of the regular credit card auto payment.
This active count is the number of balance transfers currently active on the credit card account. A rate is currently active if it has not been paid off and it has not been migrated to another plan.

A balance transfer plan provides a discounted interest rate for a specific period of time for balances that are transferred from a non-CBA Australian credit card.
Each plan has a term (in months) which is the number of bill cycles the rate is valid for. Once the plan has reached it's term the balance of the plan will be transferred to the cash advance interest rate.
This flag will be set to Y when an account has one or more balance transfer plans that are due to expire. Due to expire is defined as the number of times billed being one less than the term.

This interest rate will be set to the interest rate of the credit card balance transfer due to expire. In the unlikely event of there being 2 different interest rates, the interest rate will be set to null.
Credit card bill code

Credit Card Account Current Block Code.  This is a 2 character code derived by the concatenation of the GCPS Block Code and GCPS Reclass Code. If either field is null or blank it is replaced with an underscore.
The card scheme of a credit card i.e. A (for Amex), V (for Visa)
Count of customers tied to the credit card account (BCA010, ZBCA10, BCA040, BCA045)
This feature represents credit card account collection class code. Code OPENP indicates that Credit Card Account is on a Payment Plan.
This attribute defines current offer code associate with credit card, such as special pricing or wealth package
Credit limit on a credit card account
Average Credit Card Utilisation (in percentage) over last 30 days
Average Credit Card Utilisation (in percentage) over last 60 days
Average Credit Card Utilisation (in percentage) over last 90 days

Credit card expiry Year and Month –

201809
202211
null
CC Payment Cycle Due Amount
This active count is the number of great rates currently active on the credit card account. A rate is currently active if it has not been paid off and it has not been migrated to another plan.

A great rate is a special rate applied to part of a credit card's balance.
Each plan has a term (in months) which is the number of bill cycles the rate is valid for. Once the plan has reached it's term the balance of the plan will be transferred to the purchase rate.
This flag will be set to Y when an credit card account has one or more great rate plans that are due to expire. Due to expire is defined as the number of times billed being one less than the term.
This interest rate will be set to the interest rate of the great rate due to expire. In the unlikely event of there being 2 different interest rates, the interest rate will be set to null.
The date that the system or an operator last updated the credit card account’s block or reclass code.
The last changed date of credit limit on a credit card

A unique identifier for all accounts that have been run through the Commscore Credit Limit Increase program.
This is loaded to CEE and then passed downstream for reporting and other purposes.
The format is the account number left padded to 20 characters followed by the date in yyyymmdd format. This format may change so should not be used for any other purpose than as a CLI elgibility identifier.
CLI Offer Date
CLI Offer Limit
This attribute calculates the number of days the Term Deposit account has been in the holding facility. A Holding Facility is when the TD matures, the balance is moved to a lower interest rate.
Code to indicate of the account originated from an Individual or an Employer.
Account originating channel type code: Online, Branch, or Transitioned from another account.
This field contains the encrypted value of the Card Expiry Date.

Values can be
0 – No Segment, not agent/staff linked to account
1 – Home Loan Solution Segment (owner agent currently is a HLS)
2 – Home Loan Solution Segment (owner agent currently is non-current HLS)
3 – Mobile Lender Segment (staff currently is a mobile lender)
4 – Mortgage Brokers, dbst_type = 'MOR'
5 – Others

HLS Guarantors exist flag.
Values Y/N

HLS Initial instalment due date.
System generated when the loan becomes fully funded or repayments commence.If loan is funded between 1st - 28th ( inclusive ) the IDD is set to the corresponding day in the month immediately following date of funding. If funded between 29th - 31st ( inclusive ) IDD is set to the 1st of the month following the month after loan is funded. 
Eg: Funding date 30th May- IDD will be set to the 1st July.
Day of the month when IDD is set can also be selected by borrowers at initial input of loan.

HLS Next instalment due amount.

This item is redefined
SHL
 The amount due on the next Instalment Due Date.
 This amount is the amount payable as the next Fortnightly instalment.
HL
 This is the minimum amount required to repay the loan within the contracted term.
 The amount in the field will always be the monthly amount.
 If the Monthly service fee is being debited to this loan then it is included in this amount.
 If Insurance is debited to the Home Loan, the amount of Insurance Premium and Stamp Duty is included in this field.

HLS Next review date.

The date on which the loan is to be reviewed (3 yearly reviews).

HLS Next repayment date.

This item is redefined
Date present only for Fortnightly and Weekly repayments. For Monthly use IDD day of the month

•0 = Direct Debit

HLS Interest only period
Interest only period (in months) that will apply to a loan with a fixed term maturity date upon expiry of the current fixed period. This field is used when the customer wants to change from principal and interest repayments to interest only repayments on a loan with a fixed maturity date (ie. fixed rate, guaranteed rate , and existing Interest Only variable rate housing loans). Home loans that will not become interest only are defaulted to zero. The change from principal and interest repayments to interest only repayments is made upon expiry of the fixed period of the loan.

HLS Pending repayment amount.
Repayment to be applied on loans that have a Maturity Date recorded and which is applied at Maturity Date.

HLS Point of sale code.
•01 - DIRECT BANKING ORIGINATED   
•02 - MOBILE LENDER ORIGINATOR      
•03 - BRANCH ORIGINATED       
•04 - THIRD PARTY ORIGINATED  
•05- BUSINESS BANKING       
•06- CITIBANK       
•07- CLIENT SUPP BANK       
•08- COMMERCIAL CONVEY       
•09- INNOVATORS       
•10- PREM ADDVAN SERV       
•11- PREM BANK INVEST SERV      
•12- PRIV CLIENT SERV       
•13- HOMEPATH       
•14- INTERNET       
•15- DIRECT MAIL
•16 – Commonwealth Private Bank
•17 – Corporate and Business Services
•18 - PL FINEST ONLINE
•19 – Wizard Home Loans
•20 – Storm Loans

HLS Progressive payment flag

Values Y/N

N = multiple drawings not allowed
Y = multiple drawings allowed

On the 15th of each month, accrued interest is charged to Client’s nominated account.
When the loan is fully funded, broken period interest is also charged to this account.  From this point on, interest is charged to the Loan Account on the Instalment Due Date

HLS Repayment frequency code.
Indicates how often repayments are made
W = weekly
F = fortnightly
M = monthly

HLS Second mortgage code.
Indicates if there is a 2nd Mortgage on the security property
0 = nil
1 = second mortgage on security
2 =  second mortgage to CBA

HLS Security valuation amount.
The value of the property

HLS Setoff account balance amount.
Current  balance of  MISA / setoff account.

HLS Special repayment amount.
If positive value represents the total special repayments amount.  That is repayments which are made over and above the Required Monthly Repayment amount. This value is stored in RMR Amount.
If a negative value it represents the actual amount of the arrears. The Amount Due Next Instalment or RMR Amount is deducted from this field on the IDD.

HLS Special repayment redraw flag.
Values Y/N.
Indicates whether amount in Special Repayments may be “redrawn” by client.
Note that only amounts of Special Repayments above $2000 are available for redraw.
N = not available for redraw
Y = redraw available

HLS Staff loan code
Identifies if staff are party to a loan , used in conjunction with the staff number field

Housing Loans

1 = staff concessional interest rate
2 = Loan Taken by mobile banker
3 = Loan taken by other staff Member
9 = Edge Credit Score ID
SHLs
0 = nil repayments
3 = weekly repayments
4 = fortnightly repayments
5-9 = not used

State or Territory where the loan is conducted

4 = QLD

7 = TAS
8 = NT
